conclusion: Determine the time t1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder.
The wooden rod is released from rest and falls freely under gravity. The distance from the suspension point to point A is 20 m.
Using the equation of motion for free fall, h = (1/2) g t^2, solve for t when h = 20 m and g = 10 m/s^2.
Calculate t: 20 = (1/2) * 10 * t^2, resulting in t = 2 s.
The distance from the suspension point to point B is 25 m (since the cylinder is 5 m tall).
Using the equation of motion, solve for t when h = 25 m and g = 10 m/s^2.
Calculate t: 25 = (1/2) * 10 * t^2, resulting in t = sqrt(5) s.
The time t1 it takes for the rod to pass through the cylinder is the difference between the time to reach B and the time to reach A: t1 = sqrt(5) - 2.
Calculate t1: t1 = 2.236 - 2, resulting in t1 â‰ˆ 0.236 s.
The time t1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder is approximately 0.236 s.
